The article [[:Matthew Zissimos]] has been speedily deleted from Wikipedia. This was done because the article seemed to be about a person, group of people, band, club, company, or web content, but it did not indicate how or why the subject is notable, that is, why an article about that subject should be included in Wikipedia. Under the [[WP:CSD#Articles|criteria for speedy deletion]], articles that do not assert notability may be deleted at any time. If you can indicate why the subject is really notable, you are free to re-create the article, making sure to [[Wikipedia:Citing sources|cite]] any [[Wikipedia:Verifiability|verifiable sources]].

Please [[Wikipedia:Notability|see the guidelines for what is generally accepted as notable]], and for specific types of articles, you may want to check out our criteria [[Wikipedia:Notability (people)|for biographies]], [[WP:WEB|for web sites]], [[WP:MUSIC|for musicians]], or [[WP:CORP|for companies]]. Feel free to leave a note on my talk page if you have any questions about this.<!-- Template:Nn-warn-deletion -->  [[User:NawlinWiki|NawlinWiki]] 19:48, 9 October 2007 (UTC)

title: Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Paulo Pinheiro
content:
:''The following discussion is an archived debate of the proposed deletion of the article below. '''Please do not modify it.''' Subsequent comments should be made on the appropriate discussion page (such as the article's [[Help:Using talk pages|talk page]] or in a [[Wikipedia:Deletion review|deletion review]]). No further edits should be made to this page.'' The result was '''no consensus'''. Another two weeks have passed without any addition to the discussion. {{NAC}} [[User:Kraxler|Kraxler]] ([[User talk:Kraxler|talk]]) 16:28, 1 August 2015 (UTC) ===[[Paulo Pinheiro]]=== :{{la|Paulo Pinheiro}} – ([[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Paulo Pinheiro|View AfD]][[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Log/2015 July 25#{{anchorencode:Paulo Pinheiro}}|View log]]{{int:dot-separator}} [https://tools.wmflabs.org/jackbot/snottywong/cgi-bin/votecounter.cgi?page=Wikipedia:Articles_for_deletion/Paulo_Pinheiro Stats]) :({{Find sources AFD|Paulo Pinheiro}}) Curriculum vitae for non-notable scientist. [[User:Damiens.rf|damiens.rf]] 17:26, 8 July 2015 (UTC) :Note: This debate has been included in the [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Deletion sorting/United States of America|list of United States of America-related deletion discussions]]. [[User:Gene93k|• Gene93k]] ([[User talk:Gene93k|talk]]) 20:05, 8 July 2015 (UTC) :Note: This debate has been included in the [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Deletion sorting/Academics and educators|list of Academics and educators-related deletion discussions]]. [[User:Gene93k|• Gene93k]] ([[User talk:Gene93k|talk]]) 20:05, 8 July 2015 (UTC) :Note: This debate has been included in the [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Deletion sorting/Computing|list of Computing-related deletion discussions]]. [[User:Gene93k|• Gene93k]] ([[User talk:Gene93k|talk]]) 20:05, 8 July 2015 (UTC) *'''Keep'''. [https://scholar.google.com/scholar?q=author%3Apaulo-pinheiro-da-silva Google scholar] shows 7 publications with over 100 citations each (all I believe by the subject) and an h-index of 22, enough to show significant contributions to the subject and I think enough to pass [[WP:PROF#C1]]. —[[User:David Eppstein|David Eppstein]] ([[User talk:David Eppstein|talk]]) 20:49, 8 July 2015 (UTC) *'''Delete''' As per [[Wikipedia:Notability_(academics)#Citation_metrics]], citation metrics alone, let alone citation metrics from Google, are probably not sufficient to establish notability. In addition, the policy does not give any numeric value for ''highly cited'' -- which is frustrating. I looked at some well-known scientists, and their ground-breaking articles are cited in the thousands or tens of thousands of times, not the hundreds. [https://scholar.google.com/scholar?hl=en&q=george+smoot&btnG=&as_sdt=1%2C5&as_sdtp=], [https://scholar.google.com/scholar?q=saul+perlmutter&btnG=&hl=en&as_sdt=0%2C5]. From my reading, it looks like this person is primarily known for having developed a markup language, but he did that with a group of scholars at Stanford, so it's hard to know what his contribution was. One of his co-authors on that project has documents that have been cited more than 4K times, and journal articles cited in the high three digits, as a comparison.[https://scholar.google.com/scholar?q=debora+l+mcguinness&btnG=&hl=en&as_sdt=0%2C5]. I think this is less than a slam-dunk, and don't see anything extraordinary about this researcher. This may be a case of [[WP:TOOSOON]]. [[User:LaMona|LaMona]] ([[User talk:LaMona|talk]]) 19:27, 10 July 2015 (UTC) :*'''Comment''' I'm seeing some quite possible [[wp:COI]] due to the preponderance of SPA's on both the Pinheiro and [[Provenance Markup Language]] pages, including [[User:Pp3223]]. [[User:LaMona|LaMona]] ([[User talk:LaMona|talk]]) 19:36, 10 July 2015 (UTC) *'''Weak keep'''. [[User:LaMona]] seems to be reading [[Wikipedia:Notability_(academics)#Citation_metrics]] in a sense pretty much contrary to what I read it as saying. It fairly clearly accepts citation metrics as an admittedly somewhat imperfect method of establishing notability through measuring academic impact and is mainly concerned with allowing for these imperfections - for instance, taking account of differing expected citation rates in different subjects and, where these rates are low, supplementing or replacing them by other methods of measuring impact. What seems to be the general consensus does ''not'' expect citation rates to be at the astronomical levels that [[User:LaMona]] cites, but rather at the kind of level where a beginning postgraduate in a related subject at an institution without direct connections with the academic concerned might be expected to come across mentions of them. In this case, I note that the subject of the article actually seems to have slightly higher citation rates than any of the most recent [[Fields Medal]]lists - and, while I would expect slightly higher citation rates in computer science than in mathematics, I am still inclined to agree with [[User:David Eppstein]] that the subject's rates are still at least adequate for notability. Having said that, I do share [[User:LaMona]]'s concerns about [[WP:COI]] - the article as it stands is somewhat over-promotional and, together with the creator's username, this does suggest the possibility of [[WP:AUTOBIO]]. If the article is kept, we do not need every detail of his qualifications, career and relatives. [[User:PWilkinson|PWilkinson]] ([[User talk:PWilkinson|talk]]) 13:56, 12 July 2015 (UTC)
'''{{resize|91%|[[Wikipedia:Deletion process#Relisting discussions|Relisted]] to generate a more thorough discussion and clearer consensus.}}'''
Please add new comments below this notice. Thanks, [[User:Davewild|Davewild]] ([[User talk:Davewild|talk]]) 07:08, 16 July 2015 (UTC)
'''{{resize|91%|[[Wikipedia:Deletion process#Relisting discussions|Relisted]] to generate a more thorough discussion and clearer consensus.}}'''
Please add new comments below this notice. Thanks, '''[[User:MBisanz|MBisanz]]''' [[User talk:MBisanz|talk]] 19:26, 25 July 2015 (UTC)

Subsequent comments should be made on the appropriate discussion page (such as the article's [[Help:Using talk pages|talk page]] or in a [[Wikipedia:Deletion review|deletion review]]). No further edits should be made to this page.

title: User talk:George Hall
content:
==Welcome to the Wikipedia'''!'''==

Hello, and [[Wikipedia:Welcome, newcomers|Welcome]] to the [[Wikipedia]],George Hall!  Thanks for contributing the link over at the [[Cory Doctorow]] article.  Here are a few perfunctory tips to hasten your [[acculturation]] into the Wikipedia experience:

* Take a look at the [[Wikipedia:Tutorial|Wikipedia Tutorial]] and [[Wikipedia:Manual of Style|Manual of Style]].
* When you have time, please peruse [[Wikipedia:Five pillars|The five pillars of Wikipedia]], and [[Wikipedia:Assume good faith|Assume good faith]], but keep in mind the unique style you brought to the Wiki!
* Always be mindful of striving for [[NPOV]], be respectful of others' [[POV]], and remember ''your perspective on the meaning of [[neutral]]ity is invaluable''!
* If you need any [[Wikipedia:Help|help]], post your question at the [[Wikipedia:Help desk|Help Desk]].
* Explore, [[Wikipedia:Be bold in updating pages|be bold in editing]], and, above all else, have [[fun]]!

And some odds and ends:  [[Wikipedia:Boilerplate text|Boilerplate text]], [[Wikipedia:Brilliant prose|Brilliant prose]], [[Wikipedia:Cite your sources|Cite your sources]], [[Wikipedia:Civility|Civility]], [[Wikipedia:Conflict resolution|Conflict resolution]], [[Wikipedia:How to edit a page|How to edit a page]], [[Wikipedia:How to write a great article|How to write a great article]], [[Wikipedia:Pages needing attention|Pages needing attention]], [[Wikipedia:Peer review|Peer review]], [[Wikipedia:Policy Library|Policy Library]], [[Wikipedia:Utilities|Utilities]], [[Wikipedia:Verifiability|Verifiability]], [[Wikipedia:Village pump|Village pump]], and [[Wikipedia:Wikiquette|Wikiquette]]; also, you can sign your name on any page by typing four tildes: ~~~~.  

Best of luck, George Hall, and most importantly, have fun!  [[User:Ombudsman|Ombudsman]] 13:48, 27 April 2006 (UTC)

title: Talk:Harald Quandt
content:
{{WikiProject Aviation|class=start| b1 <!--Referencing & citations--> =n
| b2 <!--Coverage and accuracy  --> =n
| b3 <!--Structure              --> = y
| b4 <!--Grammar and style      --> =n
| b5 <!--Supporting materials   --> =n|Biography=yes}}
{{WikiProject Biography|living=no|class=start|listas=Quandt, Harald}}


==Untitled==
Not sure I understand the last edit, was he not the eldest child? [[User:Sherurcij|Sherurcij]] 17:55, 30 September 2005 (UTC)

I don´t understand the sentence about his first crash at Zurich airport. It´s quite clear how this deals with his description as a keen pilot, but I don´t think his model railway at home has anything to do with that crash, as it sounds in this part of the article.. So please rewrite these sentences.

== Some more information about his hobbies ==

I´ve just added some information about his other hobbies to the forth part of the article, just to divide the crash at Zurich Airport from his model railway at home. Overall, it´s a very informative article - the German Wikipedia is much shorter!!

::Much thanks for your help :)  [[User:Sherurcij|Sherurcij]] <sup>([[User_talk:Sherurcij|talk]]) ([[Wikipedia:WikiProject Terrorism|Terrorist Wikiproject]])</sup> 22:00, 21 March 2006 (UTC)


== Harald´s childhood ==

Hi, 
I´ve just tried to sort out the timeline of Haralds childhood. It´s a bit complicated to explain, when he lived where during this time: When divorcing, his natural parents agreed that he should live with his mother - what´s normal in such cases - until she would marry again. (Of course, Magda didn´t think of re-marriage at that time, so she agreed.) When meeting Goebbels and falling in love with him, she tried to cancel that agreement, but was successful only three years after marrying him, in 1934 after the Nazis took power. Since then, Harald again stayed with her at the Goebbels household until 1940, when he finished school and joined the army.

With best regards, 
Eva



== ARD programme October 2007 ==

Don´t mistake me, the information about the ARD feature is quite necessary and interesting, but
shouldn´t this part be removed from this article and better been mentioned with Günther or Herbert Quandt? I suppose the film ARD made deals with the actions of his father and half-brother during the war, so it should be mentioned more likely with one of them. It´s nothing Harald himself was engaged in, because he was at war in this years.- It might be interesting, by the way, that these film was shown at ARD only after 11:00 pm, when only few people were watching TV. The reason for this is quite clear: Quandt family is the owner of the German car producer BMW - of cause nobody in the German media can be interested to annoy them!!!

Many regards, Eva  <small>—Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/87.79.1.52|87.79.1.52]] ([[User talk:87.79.1.52|talk]]) 02:59, 25 January 2008 (UTC)</small><!-- Template:UnsignedIP --> <!--Autosigned by SineBot-->


== Cities of studies ==
 
I´ve just added an explanation for his chosen cities to study - he went to Hannover and Stuttgart at all, because he could easily earn some money during the vacations there. (His father provided him only with small amounts of money, to teach him householding early enough, so that he would be able to work with large amounts of money respectable later.)

== Business dealings of the father ==
This is an article about Harald Quandt and not his father. The paragraph about the business dealings of his father just doesn't belong here.--[[User:Lukati|Lukati]] ([[User talk:Lukati|talk]]) 16:26, 27 December 2013 (UTC)

== Manipulated image? ==

Why should the photo in this article be manipulated (copy and paste)? It was taken up at the birthday of Harald´s stepfather in 1942 (not a "round" one, of course), three days later Harald himself celebrated his 21st birthday - is it impossible that he was allowed driving home for these reasons if there was "all quiet on the western front?" Have a nice evening, Eva[[Special:Contributions/87.166.209.101|87.166.209.101]] ([[User talk:87.166.209.101|talk]]) 18:54, 5 April 2014 (UTC)

'''''Trochotoma''''' is a [[genus]] of large [[sea snail]]s, [[marine (ocean)|marine]] [[gastropod]] [[mollusk]]s in the [[family (biology)|family]] [[Pleurotomariidae]], the slit snails.<ref name="WoRMS">Bouchet, P. (2013). ''Trochotoma'' Eudes-Deslongchamps, 1842. Accessed through:  [[World Register of Marine Species]] at http://www.marinespecies.org/aphia.php?p=taxdetails&id=719303 on 2013-02-16</ref>

==Species==
'''The following species were brought into synonymy:'''<ref name="WoRMS" />
* ''Trochotoma crossei'' <small>de Folin, 1869</small>: synonym of ''[[Sinezona cingulata]]'' <small>(O. G. Costa, 1861)</small>

If you are stuck, and looking for help, please come to the '''[[Wikipedia:New contributors' help page|New contributors' help page]]''', where experienced Wikipedians can answer any queries you have! Or, you can just type '''{{tl|helpme}}''' on this page, and someone will show up shortly to answer your questions. Here are a few other good links for newcomers: * [[Wikipedia:Your first article|Your first article]] * [[Wikipedia:BLP|Biographies of living persons]] * [[Wikipedia:How to write a great article|How to write a great article]] * [[Wikipedia:Five pillars|The five pillars of Wikipedia]] * [[Help:Contents|Help pages]] * [[Wikipedia:Tutorial|Tutorial]] I hope you enjoy editing here and being a [[Wikipedia:Wikipedians|Wikipedian]]! Please [[Wikipedia:Sign your posts on talk pages|sign your name]] on talk pages using four tildes (~~~~); this will automatically produce your name and the date. If you have any questions, check out [[Wikipedia:Where to ask a question]] or ask me on {{#if:|[[User talk:{{{2}}}{{!}}my talk page]]|my talk page}}. Again, welcome! [[User:Eeekster|Eeekster]] ([[User talk:Eeekster|talk]]) 08:29, 1 December 2009 (UTC) ==[[Wikipedia:Criteria for speedy deletion|Speedy deletion]] nomination of [[:Anastasia Penington]]== [[Image:Ambox warning_pn.svg|48px|left]] A tag has been placed on [[:Anastasia Penington]] requesting that it be speedily deleted from Wikipedia. This has been done under [[WP:CSD#A7|section A7 of the criteria for speedy deletion]], because the article appears to be about a person or group of people, but it does not indicate how or why the subject is important or significant: that is, why an article about that subject should be included in an encyclopedia. Under the [[WP:CSD#Articles|criteria for speedy deletion]], such articles may be deleted at any time. Please [[Wikipedia:Notability|see the guidelines for what is generally accepted as notable]], as well as our subject-specific [[Wikipedia:Notability (people)|notability guideline for biographies]]. You may also wish to consider using a Wizard to help you create articles - see the [[Wikipedia:Article wizard2.0|Article Wizard]]. If you think that this notice was placed here in error, you may contest the deletion by adding {{tl|hangon}} to '''the top of [[:Anastasia Penington|the page that has been nominated for deletion]]''' (just below the existing speedy deletion or "db" tag), coupled with adding a note on '''[[Talk:Anastasia Penington|the talk page]]''' explaining your position, but be aware that once tagged for ''speedy'' deletion, if the page meets the criterion it may be deleted without delay. Please do not remove the speedy deletion tag yourself, but don't hesitate to add information to the page that would render it more in conformance with Wikipedia's policies and guidelines. Lastly, please note that if the page does get deleted, you can contact [[:Category:Wikipedia administrators who will provide copies of deleted articles|one of these admins]] to request that they [[Wikipedia:Userfication#Userfication_of_deleted_content|userfy]] the page or have a copy emailed to you. [[User:Eeekster|Eeekster]] ([[User talk:Eeekster|talk]]) 08:29, 1 December 2009 (UTC)

title: User talk:Adammos~enwiki
content:
== Your account will be renamed ==
Hello, The developer team at Wikimedia is making some changes to how accounts work, as part of our on-going efforts to provide new and better tools for our users like cross-wiki notifications. These changes will mean you have the same account name everywhere. This will let us give you new features that will help you edit and discuss better, and allow more flexible user permissions for tools. One of the side-effects of this is that user accounts will now have to be unique across all 900 Wikimedia wikis. See [[m:Special:MyLanguage/Single User Login finalisation announcement|the announcement]] for more information. Unfortunately, your account clashes with another account also called Adammos. To make sure that both of you can use all Wikimedia projects in future, we have reserved the name Adammos~enwiki that only you will have. If you like it, you don't have to do anything. If you do not like it, you can [[Special:GlobalRenameRequest|pick out a different name]]. If you think you might own all of the accounts with this name and this message is in error, please visit [[Special:MergeAccount]] to check and attach all of your accounts to prevent them from being renamed. Your account will still work as before, and you will be credited for all your edits made so far, but you will have to use the new account name when you log in. Sorry for the inconvenience. Yours,
[[m:User:Keegan (WMF)|Keegan Peterzell]]
Community Liaison, Wikimedia Foundation
21:38, 19 March 2015 (UTC) == Renamed ==

title: Talk:Pharmakon (philosophy)
content:
{{WikiProject Articles for creation|class=start|ts=20160127052229|reviewer=Devopam|oldid=701606368}}
{{WikiProject Philosophy|class=start}}

As I note on the [[Talk:Indeterminacy_(philosophy)#I_think_there_should_be_a_separate_page_for_pharmakon|talk page for Indeterminacy_(philosophy)]], the notion of ''pharmakon'' needs to be defined separately.  It is '''not''' a term that means "a concept that has some indeterminacy", as one might gather from the [[Pharmakon_(disambiguation)|disambiguation page]].  The disambiguation page should point here, instead.  A suitable one-line definition is:

: "any treatment that is both a poison and a remedy"

[[User:Arided|Arided]] ([[User talk:Arided|talk]]) 20:44, 7 January 2016 (UTC)

== another interesting paper, this one about addiction ==

[http://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s11013-014-9376-9 Promise and Deceit: Pharmakos, Drug Replacement Therapy, and the Perils of Experience].

[[User:Arided|Arided]] ([[User talk:Arided|talk]]) 03:09, 9 January 2016 (UTC)

== therapeutics and attention ==

It's interesting (in the "media philosophy" example) to note that therapeutics means ''care'', which Stiegler emphasizes is closely related to ''attention''.  So there's something a bit meta about a therapeutics addressed towards a pharmacology of attention.  [[User:Arided|Arided]] ([[User talk:Arided|talk]]) 21:24, 19 January 2016 (UTC)

title: Cristina Dinu
content:
{{Use dmy dates|date=August 2013}} {{Infobox tennis biography | name = Cristina Dinu | fullname = | image= CristinaDinu.jpg | caption = Cristina Dinu at the [[2010 US Open (tennis)|2010 US Open]] | country = {{ROM}} | residence = [[Bucharest]], Romania | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1993|1|18}} | birth_place = [[Bucharest]], Romania | height = | weight = | turnedpro = 2009 | retired = | plays = Right-handed (two-handed backhand) | careerprizemoney = [[US$|$]]107,554 | singlesrecord = 224 - 112 | singlestitles = 0 WTA, 13 ITF | highestsinglesranking = No. 179 (30 September 2013) | currentsinglesranking = No. 230 (1 January 2016) | AustralianOpenresult = | FrenchOpenresult = | Wimbledonresult = | USOpenresult = Q1 (2013) | doublesrecord = 108 - 68 | doublestitles = 0 WTA, 9 ITF | highestdoublesranking = No. 210 (28 October 2013) | currentdoublesranking = No. 235 (1 January 2016) | grandslamsdoublesresults= | AustralianOpenDoublesresult = | FrenchOpenDoublesresult = | WimbledonDoublesresult = | USOpenDoublesresult = | updated = 1 January 2016 }} '''Cristina Dinu''' (born 18 January 1993 in [[Bucharest]]) is a professional [[Romania]]n [[tennis]] player. Dinu has won thirteen singles and Seven doubles titles on the ITF tour in her career. On 30 September 2013, she reached her best singles ranking of world number 179. On 28 October 2013, she peaked at world number 210 in the doubles rankings. In July 2015 Cristina Dinu attended [[Bucharest Open|WTA WTA-250 BRD Bucharest-Open ($226,750)]], and she has won three consecutive qualifying rounds (def. Yaroslava Shvedova (1) in the last round) eventually losing on the main draw to Denisa Allertova after a thrilling match. title: Georgia White
content:
'''Georgia White''' (March 9, 1903 – c.1980) was an [[African American]] [[blues]] [[singer]], most prolific in the 1930s and 1940s.

Little is known of her early life.  By the late 1920s she was singing in [[nightclub|clubs]] in [[Chicago]], and she made her first [[sound recording and reproduction|recording]], "When You're Smiling, the Whole World Smiles With You," with [[Jimmie Noone]]'s [[orchestra]] in 1930.  She returned to the [[recording studio|studio]] in 1935, and over the next six years recorded over 100 tracks for [[Decca Records]], usually accompanied by the [[pianist]] Richard M. Jones and also, in the late 1930s, by [[guitarist]] [[Lonnie Johnson (musician)|Lonnie Johnson]].<ref name="russell">{{cite book
| first= Tony
| last= Russell
| year= 1997
| title= The Blues - From [[Robert Johnson (musician)|Robert Johnson]] to [[Robert Cray]]
| edition= 
| publisher=Carlton Books Limited 
| location= Dubai
| page=185
| isbn= 1-85868-255-X}}</ref>

She also recorded under the name Georgia Lawson.  Tracks included "I'll Keep Sitting on It," "Take Me for a Buggy Ride," "Mama Knows What Papa Wants When Papa's Feeling Blue," and "Hot Nuts."  Her best-known song was "You Done Lost Your Good Thing Now" (1935).<ref name="russell"/>

White formed an all-women band in the 1940s, and also performed with [[Bumble Bee Slim]].  She joined [[Big Bill Broonzy]]'s Laughing Trio in 1949 as pianist. "She was very easy to get along with," said Broonzy. "Real friendly."<ref name="russell"/> She was a club singer in the 1950s, finally  performing in 1959 in Chicago.  She then resumed performing weekends at the Blue Pub, a bar on Irving Park Road near the Kennedy Expressway, where she quickly won a loyal following.  She arrived and left by cab, always dressed as a star.  She sang many of her famous songs but the one she loved the most and did brilliantly was "Maybe I'm Wrong Again," a ballad from an early Bing Crosby movie.  Crosby had recorded it and one or two British bands.  I know because I arrived in Chicago in September, 1964, from St. Louis and one of my new friends took me to the Blue Pub particularly to hear Georgia as I was in the music business (also a journalist and about to become a teacher).  I was immediately caught up in her music and style and we talked a lot.  I could never find "Maybe I'm Wrong Again," a record or sheet music or anything but I made a record of it using only the lyrics I knew from Georgia's performances. Around 2001 I finally found a British C.D. with Bing's recording and was surprised to find I had gotten the melody and the lyrics exactly right.

One of her songs, "Alley Boogie" (recorded November 9, 1937),<ref>{{cite AV media notes |title=Blues Women |year=1996 |publisher=[[Orbis Publishing]] |id=BLU NC 073 }}</ref> was used as the [[theme music]] for the British romantic comedy drama series, ''[[Love Soup]].''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.phill.co.uk/comedy/lovesoup/ |title=Love Soup (Summary) |publisher=Phill.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2014-02-16}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.tv.com/shows/love-soup/ |title=Love Soup |publisher=TV.com |date= |accessdate=2014-02-16}}</ref>

==See also==
*[[List of classic female blues singers]]

title: User talk:GryffonDurime
content:
== Welcome == Hi, {{BASEPAGENAME}}. This is NOT some automated message...it's from a real person. You can [http://toolserver.org/~bjelleklang/pjirc/ talk to me right now]. Welcome to Wikipedia! I noticed you've just joined, and wanted to give you a few tips to get you started. If you have any questions, please [http://toolserver.org/~bjelleklang/pjirc/ talk to us]. The tips below should help you to get started. Best of luck! [[User:Chzz|'''  Chzz ''']][[User talk:Chzz| ► ]] 17:37, 27 April 2009 (UTC) {| style="background-color:#F5FFFA; padding:0;" cellpadding="0"; |style="border:1px solid #084080; background-color:##E6F2FF; vertical-align:top; color:#000000;"| [[image:Wikipe-tan_face.jpg|thumb|ようこそ]] *'''You don't need to read anything''' - anybody can edit; just go to an article and edit it. [[WP:BOLD|Be Bold]], but please don't put silly stuff in - it will be removed very quickly, and will annoy people. *'''Ask for help'''. [http://toolserver.org/~bjelleklang/pjirc/ Talk to us live], or edit this page, put '''{{tl|helpme}}''' and describe what help you need. Someone will reply very quickly - usually within a few minutes. *'''Play''' in your user area. For example, create [[User:{{BASEPAGENAME}}/test]]. *'''Edit existing articles''', before you make your own. Look at some subjects that you know about, and see if you can make them a bit better. For example, [[Wikipedia:Cleanup#2009]]. *'''When you're ready''', read about [[Wikipedia:Your first article|Your first article]]. It should be about something well-known, and it will need references. Good luck with editing; please drop me a line some time on [[User talk:{{REVISIONUSER}}|my own talk page]]. There's lots of information below. Once again, welcome to the fantastic world of Wikipedia! --[[User:Chzz|'''  Chzz ''']][[User talk:Chzz| ► ]] 17:37, 27 April 2009 (UTC) {| width="100%" style="background-color:#F5FFFA;" |style="width: 55%; border:1px solid #FFFFFF; background-color:#F5FFFA; vertical-align:top"| {| width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="5" style="vertical-align:top; background-color:#F5FFFA" !
Getting started
|- |style="color:#000"| * [[Wikipedia:Tutorial|A tutorial]] • [[Wikipedia:Five pillars|Our five pillars]] • [[Wikipedia:Adopt-a-User|Getting mentored]] * How to: [[Wikipedia:How to edit a page|edit a page]] • [[Wikipedia:Images|upload and use images]] * [[Wikipedia:FAQ|Frequently asked questions]] • [[Wikipedia:Tips|Tips]] * [[Wikipedia:Questions|Where to ask questions or make comments]] * [[Wikipedia:Requests for administrator attention|Request administrator attention]] |- !
Policies and guidelines
|- | style="color:#000"| * [[Wikipedia:Neutral point of view|Neutral point of view]] • [[Wikipedia:No original research|No original research]] * [[Wikipedia:Verifiability|Verifiability]] • [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources|Grade sources]] • [[Wikipedia:Citing sources|Cite sources]] * [[Wikipedia:What Wikipedia is not|What Wikipedia is not]] • [[Wikipedia:Biographies of living persons|Biographies of living persons]] * [[Wikipedia:External links|External links]] • [[Wikipedia:Spam|Spam]] • [[Wikipedia:Vandalism|Vandalism]] * [[Wikipedia:Deletion policy|Deletion policy]] • [[Wikipedia:Conflict of interest|Conflict of interest]] • [[Wikipedia:Notability|Notability]] |- |} |class="MainPageBG" style="width: 55%; border:1px solid #FFFFFF; background-color:#F5FFFA; vertical-align:top"| {| width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="5" style="vertical-align:top; background-color:#F5FFFA" !
The community
|- |style="color:#000"| * [[Wikipedia:Wikipedia Signpost|Signpost]] • [[Wikipedia:IRC channels|IRC channels]] • [[Wikipedia:Mailing lists|Mailing lists]] • [[Wikipedia:FA|Best articles]] * [[Wikipedia:Consensus|Build consensus]] • [[Wikipedia:Dispute resolution|Resolve disputes]] * [[Wikipedia:Assume good faith|Assume good faith]] • [[Wikipedia:Civility|Civility]] • [[Wikipedia:Etiquette|Etiquette]] * [[Wikipedia:No personal attacks|No personal attacks]] • [[Wikipedia:No legal threats|No legal threats]] |- !
Writing articles

title: Desert Camouflage Uniform
content:
[[File:011221-N-1328C-503 JCS Visits Theodore Roosevelt.jpg|thumb|right|upright|General Richard B. Myers of the U.S. Air Force wears the Desert Camouflage Uniform during a December 2001 visit to the {{USS|Theodore Roosevelt|CVN-71}}.]] The '''Desert Camouflage Uniform''' ('''DCU''') is an American arid-environment camouflage uniform used by the [[United States Armed Forces]]. In terms of pattern and cut, it is nearly identical to the U.S. military's [[Battle Dress Uniform]] (BDU) uniform, but features a three-color desert camouflage pattern of dark brown, pale green, and beige, as opposed to the beige, pale green, two tones of brown, and black and white rock spots of the previous [[Desert Battle Dress Uniform]] (DBDU). ==History== First issued in very limited quantity in 1990 as experimental test patterns, the DCU and its camouflage scheme, officially known as the Desert Camouflage Pattern, and also known as "coffee stain camouflage", was developed to replace the six-color desert camouflage "chocolate-chip camouflage" uniform, which was deemed unsuitable for most desert combat theaters. As opposed to the original six-color DBDU, which was meant for a rockier and elevated desert battlefield that was often not encountered, the DCU was created primarily for a lower, more open, and less rocky desert battlefield space which became a common sight throughout the [[Gulf War|Persian Gulf War]]. As a replacement pattern, this meant a new arid region had to be utilized to test the effectiveness of the DCU. Desert soil samples from parts of the Middle East, namely Saudi Arabia, and Kuwait, were used as testing locations to find the appropriate color palettes. All American personnel in Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, and Iraq wore the DBDU during the entire Gulf War campaign, with the exception of some select U.S. Army generals who were issued the DCU a month following the air campaign in Desert Storm. Norman Schwarzkopf, then CENTCOM commander, and leader of American forces during Desert Storm, was issued an M-65 field jacket as well as coat and trousers in the new DCU color pattern shortly before the war ended. By 1992, the first wide scale batches of DCU's were issued first by the [[United States Army]], and within a year to the [[United States Air Force]], and replaced the majority of the DBDU by 1993, with the [[United States Navy]] and [[United States Marine Corps|Marines]] replacing their older six-colored desert fatigues from 1993 through 1995. ===U.S. Army=== [[Image:ACU-BDU-WWII uniform.jpg|thumb|upright|right|U.S. Army soldiers in May 2005 wearing the [[Army Combat Uniform]], Desert Camouflage Uniform and a World War II-era uniform (left to right).]] Fielded in 1991, the DCU served as the U.S. Army's primary desert combat pattern from 1992 to 2004. In June 2004, the Army introduced a new digital style pattern called UCP ([[Universal Camouflage Pattern]]). In 2005, the DCU and the BDU was discontinued within the [[United States Army|U.S. Army]], being replaced with the [[Army Combat Uniform]] (ACU) by 2008. ===U.S. Marine Corps=== Following the Army, the United States Marine Corps began issuing the DCU from 1993 through 1995 and remained the Marine Corps standard arid combat uniform from 1993 to 2002. In January 2002, the [[United States Marine Corps|U.S. Marine Corps]] became the first branch to replace both its BDUs and DCUs with the [[Marine Corps Combat Utility Uniform]] (MCCUU), completely replacing them in October 2004.{{cite web|url=http://www.usmc.mil/maradmins/maradmin2000.nsf/0872a7ac9a4c08a6852569b9000bc3f1/54d1925fde54478885256f170027f0b0?OpenDocument |author=Commandant of the United States Marine Corps |publisher=United States Department of the Navy |work=United States Marine Corps |date=September 22, 2004 |title=MARADMIN 412/04: MANDATORY POSSESSION DATES FOR THE MARINE CORPS COMBAT UTILITY UNIFORMS (MCCUU) AND MARINE CORPS COMBAT BOOTS (MCCB) |accessdate=September 29, 2004 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20040929112751/http://www.usmc.mil/maradmins/maradmin2000.nsf/0872a7ac9a4c08a6852569b9000bc3f1/54d1925fde54478885256f170027f0b0?OpenDocument |archivedate=September 29, 2004 }} ===U.S. Air Force=== Along with the Army, the Air Force began issuing the DCU in 1992 and remained its primary desert uniform until 2011. The [[United States Air Force|U.S. Air Force]] officially replaced the BDU and DCU on November 1, 2011 with the [[Airman Battle Uniform]] (ABU).{{cite web|url=http://www.afpc.af.mil/shared/media/document/AFD-130509-049.pdf|date=July 18, 2011|work=AFI 36-2903|author=Headquarters, United States Air Force|publisher=United States Department of the Air Force|quote=The mandatory phase in date for the ABU is 1 November 2011.|chapter=5|page=70|title=UTILITY UNIFORMS|accessdate=September 19, 2013|location=Washington, D.C.}} ===U.S. Navy=== With the Marine Corps, the United States Navy first issued its DCUs from 1993 until 2010 when it was replaced by woodland and arid variants of the NWU. The DCU and BDU has been replaced to some extent in the [[United States Navy|U.S. Navy]], supplanted by navy blue, woodland, and arid versions of the [[Navy Working Uniform]] (NWU). The U.S. Navy has authorized a replacement uniform of its own for the [[United States Navy SEALs|U.S. Navy SEALs]] while maintaining it for other [[Navy Expeditionary Combat Command|NECC]] ground units. ===U.S. Coast Guard=== The DCU was introduced to the Coast Guard sometime in the 1990s. As of the early 2010s, the DCU is still issued to members of the [[United States Coast Guard|U.S. Coast Guard]] when deployed to Southwest Asia or arid regions. ==See also== {{commons category}} ==References== {{reflist}} == External links == * [http://www.fas.org/man/dod-101/sys/land/bdu.htm FAS page with descriptions and pictures of BDU camouflage patterns] * [http://www.globalsecurity.org/military/systems/ground/bdu-desert.htm GlobalSecurity page detailing Desert BDU] * [http://www.militaryclothing.com/img/DCU%20Quick%20Find.JPG militaryclothing.com/img/DCU%20Quick%20Find.JPG]
{{US Army uniforms}} [[Category:1989 in military history]] [[Category:American military uniforms]] [[Category:Camouflage patterns]] [[Category:Military camouflage]] [[Category:History of fashion]]

title: Category:Polish basketball coaches
Talk:List of Friends episodes/Archive 1
content: {{talkarchive}} == Synposes == I am planning to create plot synopses. Any objections? [[User:Mimsie|Mimsie]] 17:52, 9 Jun 2004 (UTC) :No objections from me. My experience in episode lists demonstrates that some Wikipedians may have something to say about it though. In several talk pages about episode lists I've seen comments about articles for each episode of any given show as being "excessive" or "unnecessary". Don't be surprised if you take some heat from them. Good luck. [[User:Redux|Redux]] 21:25, 9 Jun 2004 (UTC) ::Since you are going to do this, I would suggest that you throw in an episode-by-episode list of the guest stars. We already have an [[List of guest stars on Friends|article]] about that, but it's just a simple list and there's no way to tell when or in which episode each one was there. Just a thought. [[User:Redux|Redux]] 21:39, 9 Jun 2004 (UTC) :::I've started adding 'as ....' and a brief synopsis of the guest's involvement on [[List of guest stars on Friends]]. When done I reckon I'll do so for [[Joey (sitcom)]] as well. --[[User:Hooloovoo|Hooloovoo]] 23:33, 6 Apr 2005 (UTC) ::Yes, you guys are quick, I already received the equivalent of an eyebrow raise when I started the edits. I have already looked online and although there are definitely plenty of episode guides out there, they are all canned and not very detailed. I am hoping that with the wiki format I can create a more relationship-based guide whereby connections between characters, plot consistency, etc. can be explored. My strongest argument being that [[Star Trek]] obviously has in depth coverage all over the 'net, but I think the wiki [[List of Star Trek TNG episodes]] does a great job. Thanks for the support and suggestion! == New Design == I think it is time that the episode list is formatted using the template like other episode lists. I have already started with the first three seasons as guides. I've also uploaded screenshots for the first three seasons I took using Fraps. I would like it if some more people could help me out with changing the other seasons's templates or creating the screenshots. Please make your own screenshots and do no find them on the web. --[[User:Drzoidberg91|Drzoidberg91]] 21:20, 23 February 2007 (UTC) == template == I created a template for episode navigation to replace the tables that were in some of the articles. It is {{Tld|Episode navigators}}{{Episode navigation|parent=[[List of Friends episodes|List of ''Friends'' episodes]]|prev={{{1}}}|next={{{2}}} }}. Just type {{Friends navigation|[[preceeding episode|[[following episode]]}} (with pipes in between each piece). I'm working on adding it to articles, and fixing the category sorting. I also noticed that the list isn't uniform. We should probably work on that too. I'll do some if I have the time. [[User:Lachatdelarue|Lachatdelarue]] [[User_talk:Lachatdelarue|(talk)]] 19:23, 16 July 2005 (UTC) == Standardization == People, I realize it's a lot of [boring] work, but either we have all the season listings with boards or we have plain lists for them all (as it was before). But it really doesn't sit well to have half of the listings as boards and the other half as plain lists. More importantly, it seems that the effort to convert the simple lists into boards has come to a stop. The boards are not a bad idea, but nor are they essential to an article that is meant to be a simple list of episodes (as the article is structured right now, more details, such as plot summaries, should be located in each episode's article). If there's no intention of completing this conversion task, I'd favor reverting the whole thing back to it's original appearance — remember that nothing is completely lost in Wikipedia, so if ever someone decides to complete the change, they can just bring back the boards that had already been done and take it from there. Regards, [[User:Redux|Redux]] 18:23, 15 September 2005 (UTC) == Season Infoboxes == I have created season infoboxes for every season of Friends ([[Template:Friends1|Season 1]], [[Template:Friends2|Season 2]], [[Template:Friends3|Season 3]], [[Template:Friends4|Season 4]], [[Template:Friends5|Season 5]], [[Template:Friends6|Season 6]], [[Template:Friends7|Season 7]], [[Template:Friends8|Season 8]], [[Template:Friends9|Season 9]] and [[Template:Friends10|Season 10]]). These have to be placed on every Friends episode page with the corresponding season. To place them, place {{Friends*}} on the top of every episode page, replacing the * with the season number. [[User:Squidward2602|Squidward2602]] 13:46, 16 October 2005 (UTC) :OK, these are great ''but'' there is some inconsistency in the nomenclature seasons 1,9-10 make use of the abbrieviated TOW, whilst seasons 2-8 use the full 'The One With/Where.' I have edited for consistency within seasons, but which should we use overall? I would suggest the full title as this is more accurate and clear. Others? [[User:Ck_lostsword|Ck l]][[WP:ESP|o]][[User:Ck_lostsword|stsw]][[WP:ESP|o]][[user:Ck_lostsword|rd]]|[[User_talk:Ck_lostsword|queta!]] 18:45, 10 March 2006 (UTC) ::Definitely full title. [[User:Redux|Redux]] 13:41, 11 March 2006 (UTC) == For Episode Summaries == Just wanted to point out that some brave soul on [[Geocities]] has a website with word-by-word transcriptions of, supposedly at least, ''every single Friends episode ever''. I've been writing summaries based mostly on the episodes I've personally got copies of, but theoretically we could write up summaries relying on these transcripts alone. The site is [http://www.geocities.com/vspramod/Links/friends/friends.htm http://www.geocities.com/vspramod/Links/friends/friends.htm]. [[User:Marblespire|Marblespire]] 22:53, 3 January 2006 (UTC) == Episodes category sort key == While it is important to fix the sort key, I wonder how to deal with season 10 episodes. For example, "[[The One With Princess Consuela]]" is sorted as "10-14" while causes it to appear at the end of the season 1 articles, and before the 2nd season ones. Should they be sorted "01", "02", ... "10"? The only problem is that the names in [[:Category:Friends episodes]] would be 0 or 1 only. Any advice? -- [[User:Ricky81682|Ricky81682]] ([[User talk:Ricky81682|talk]]) 23:55, 14 May 2006 (UTC) == Characters == Talking about infoboxes, I realized the characters have uneven article formatting. While Phoebe and Chandler have sidebars with statics, the rest (but Monica) have pictures. Shouldn't all have the same?--[[User:201|201]] 01:40, 7 October 2006 (UTC) == Images == I like what has been done to the page, but the images do make the page take longer to load. [[User:Samx|Samx]] 23:16, 2 March 2007 (UTC) :they are also a violation of wikipedia's [[Wikipedia:Non-free content|Non-free content policy]].[[User:Geni|Geni]] 15:08, 26 April 2007 (UTC) == Spaces and "Alerts" == I've fixed the spacing of text in this article. Please remember that sentences should be separated by a period and a space, and that a space should also follow a comma, exclamation point, or colon. I also removed the word "alert" that preceded all of the guest stars... it made the list look like it was copied from a fan site. I don't have the appropriate flashing lights and sirens on my computer to properly convey "alerts" anyway. [[User:Jaksmata|Jaksmata]] 17:37, 21 March 2007 (UTC) == Redirects == The good faith efforts by [[User:Mimsie]] (principally) to create individual articles for every episode were made before there was a clear policy about episode notability, since established at [[WP:EPISODES]]. Per that policy, it is clear that the majority of the individual Friends episode articles should be redirected to this list page where brief plot synopses can be provided; alternatively, the articles should be rewritten to address the notability issues laid out at the guideline. It should be quickly noted that plot summaries, goofs, and trivia are explicitly cited as unencyclopedic and insufficient content for individual episode articles. Over the 3 years that these articles have existed, few aspire to much more than that. [[User:Eusebeus|Eusebeus]] 11:00, 27 June 2007 (UTC) * So you just take it on yourself to invalidate hundreds of hours of work by hundreds of editors. Nice. If there was an award for vandalism you'd sweep the votes. [[User:Captain Infinity|Captain Infinity]] 20:45, 28 June 2007 (UTC) ** I await my Barnstar. Seriously, there is further discussion here: [[Talk:Friends#IMPORTANT - Notability Concerns and Redirects for Individual Episodes]]. [[User:Eusebeus|Eusebeus]] ([[User talk:Eusebeus|talk]]) 23:02, 1 March 2008 (UTC) == Format == How come there is an individual wiki page for each episode of other programs like [[Family Guy]] but for [[Friends]] we only have this list with limited information? —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/81.129.27.248|81.129.27.248]] ([[User talk:81.129.27.248|talk]]) 16:47, 12 May 2008 (UTC) :Because the Friends episodes do not meet our requirements for notability. It's just that the pages for Family Guy seem to be exactly what you don't want (a TV guide) - it seems a bit inconsistent. Also, what is 'wikifying'? I have done nothing wrong and I have not been told to stop anything in the past. Thank you. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/81.129.27.248|81.129.27.248]] ([[User talk:81.129.27.248|talk]]) 17:03, 12 May 2008 (UTC) :You were told to stop, as per the record on your talk page before you changed IPs. As for Family Guy, didn't say they did establish notability. They probably don't and need to be merged, just no one has done the proposal. [[User:AnmaFinotera|AnmaFinotera]] ([[User talk:AnmaFinotera|talk]]) 17:06, 12 May 2008 (UTC) Sorry, but could you please enlighten me as to the definition of the term 'wikify'? —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/81.129.27.248|81.129.27.248]] ([[User talk:81.129.27.248|talk]]) 19:29, 12 May 2008 (UTC) :Wikify means adding links to wiki articles. They are also called internal links. For example, changing "school" to "[[school]]" is wikifying the word school, resulting in "school" becoming "[[school]]".[[User:AnmaFinotera|AnmaFinotera]] ([[User talk:AnmaFinotera|talk]]) 19:34, 12 May 2008 (UTC) Yeah, and what's wrong with that? Isn't it one of the main ways for navigating [[Wikipedia]]? Also, when did anyone tell me to stop doing it?--[[Special:Contributions/81.129.27.248|81.129.27.248]] ([[User talk:81.129.27.248|talk]]) 19:46, 12 May 2008 (UTC) :Because the links you were adding to the episode titles were inappropriate as they all just come back to this page. Circular links are pointless, and over wikilinking is discouraged. [[User:AnmaFinotera|AnmaFinotera]] ([[User talk:AnmaFinotera|talk]]) 19:49, 12 May 2008 (UTC) OK, I'll stop doing it. Thank you. for your advice. I will now set up a Wikipedia account and you can be my mentor as I'm not very good but I wish to help.[[Special:Contributions/81.129.27.248|81.129.27.248]] ([[User talk:81.129.27.248|talk]]) 19:53, 12 May 2008 (UTC) :All these articles used to exist, some of us view their restoration as beneficial to the project. [[User:Catchpole|Catchpole]] ([[User talk:Catchpole|talk]]) 11:33, 15 May 2008 (UTC) ::Restoration requires first establishing notability. Just throwing in circular links is not an attempt at restoration, just excessive wikification. [[User:AnmaFinotera|AnmaFinotera]] ([[User talk:AnmaFinotera|talk]]) 14:55, 15 May 2008 (UTC) :: Sorry, this is ridiculous. Wikipedia has guidelines, not rules. By removing the individual episode you have reduced information on cast lists etc. This significantly reduces Wikipedia's usefulness. ::If an individual episode of Friends is not notable, then why is a list of Friends episode titles notable? What harm were the individual episode pages doing? The harm their absence has caused is to waste my time, because amongst other things I, like many other people if other episode guides are to go by, regard Wikipedia as one of the best places on the net to get this information. I'm sorry you already had a vote about this, but remember that Wikipedia guidelines specifically discourages voting as potentially counterproductive, and states they should not be considered binding. ::Sort it out, lets not let a set of guidelines hinder the usefulness of wikipedia [[User:Ajmayhew|Ajmayhew]] ([[User talk:Ajmayhew|talk]]) 09:04, 27 August 2008 (UTC) Why you guys removed the episode guides? [[Special:Contributions/117.3.36.66|117.3.36.66]] ([[User talk:117.3.36.66|talk]]) 00:05, 6 July 2008 (UTC) == Profess or Confess == During a city-wide power outage, Rachel falls for the owner of a lost kitten, a dark, attractive Italian guy, which occurs at the same time as Ross wanting to profess his love for Rachel. Shouldn't this read Confess instead? [[Special:Contributions/90.221.186.217|90.221.186.217]] ([[User talk:90.221.186.217|talk]]) 08:18, 12 January 2009 (UTC) :No. --[[User:Captain Infinity|Captain Infinity]] ([[User talk:Captain Infinity|talk]]) 19:07, 12 January 2009 (UTC) :Either would work, but profess is better. [[User:Daskill|Daskill]] ([[User talk:Daskill|talk]]) 21:44, 19 March 2009 (UTC) == Why have the individual episode pages been removed? == I believe that this needs to be discussed. Why is it that all episodes of shows like [[Family Guy]] and [[The Simpsons]] get their own pages and episodes of Friends do not? Friends is as iconic as The Simpsons, and moreso than Family guy. We can't have a rule for one series and a different one for another. [[User:Daskill|Daskill]] ([[User talk:Daskill|talk]]) 21:50, 18 March 2009 (UTC) === Request for comment === The following TV series have pages for all their episodes: [[Futurama]], [[The Simpsons]], [[Family Guy]], [[South Park]], [[American Dad]], [[Battlestar Galactica (reimagining)]], [[Doctor Who]], [[Torchwood]]...the list could go on and on and on. Friends is at least as notable if not more notable than these series. Why should articles about Friends episodes be forbidden when it is allowed for these other series? We can't have one rule for one thing and another rule for others. [[User:Daskill|Daskill]] ([[User talk:Daskill|talk]]) 21:18, 19 March 2009 (UTC) * See [[WP:OTHERSTUFFEXISTS]]. [[The Simpsons]] have episode articles because the editors have shown again and again that the episode articles can be improved to decent standards and beyond.[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Featured_topics/The_Simpsons_(season_1)][http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Featured_topics/The_Simpsons_(season_4)][http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Featured_topics/The_Simpsons_(season_6)][http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Featured_topics/The_Simpsons_(season_8)][http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Featured_topics/The_Simpsons_(season_9)] Doctor Who has got quite a bunch of Good and Featured episode articles as well.[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:WHO#Articles_with_Featured_Article_Status] On the other hand, the South Park episode articles are under discussion to get merged for non-notability. I am unable to comment on the other shows, but many of their episode articles don't fulfil basic inclusion standards either and technically shouldn't exist either. You will find the same reasoning in the archives of this talkpage (i.e. cleanup measures) for why many ''Friends'' articles no longer exist. – [[User:Sgeureka|sgeureka]] [[User_talk:Sgeureka|t]]•[[Special:Contributions/Sgeureka|c]] 22:38, 19 March 2009 (UTC) :So, because the people who were editing the episode guides two years ago didn't do a good enough job of it, no one is allowed to try in future? [[User:Daskill|Daskill]] ([[User talk:Daskill|talk]]) 22:43, 19 March 2009 (UTC) ::There was never any talk that episode articles are not allowed in the future and that you may not try. You are entitled (and actually encouraged) to write articles on any episode as long as the resulting articles pass core policies such as [[WP:NOT#PLOT]] and [[WP:OR]], and are long enough to no longer fit into the list of episodes or a season article ([[WP:SPINOUT]]). – [[User:Sgeureka|sgeureka]] [[User_talk:Sgeureka|t]]•[[Special:Contributions/Sgeureka|c]] 23:06, 19 March 2009 (UTC) :Episode articles tend to fail [[WP:GNG|notability]]. Per [[WP:OTHERSTUFFEXISTS]], the fact that fans keep creating them does not justify their presence. Maintaining a good ''List of episodes'' page would save editors the trouble of merging many episode articles into a list in the long run. (This happened to ''[[Scrubs (TV series)|Scrubs]]'' episodes, with much wailing and gnashing of teeth by ''Scrubs'' editors.) / [[User:Edgarde|edg]] [[User_talk:Edgarde|☺]] [[Special:Contributions/Edgarde|☭]] 14:56, 31 March 2009 (UTC) ::One of the problems with Friends episodes is that there are no DVD commentaries, which makes it hard to provide content for an article. You are allowed to create Friends episode article. If they have more than just a plot and an infobox, then they will be kept. --[[User:Maitch|Maitch]] ([[User talk:Maitch|talk]]) 19:42, 31 March 2009 (UTC) :::This bodes poorly for ''Friends'' episode articles. One reason ''The Simpsons'' episode articles flourish (and even reach ''[[WP:GA|GA]]'' status) is they often contain at least {{abbr|5kb|this is a loose estimate}} of unique, encyclopedic content (excluding plot summary, cast list, succession boxes, and other ''[[wikt:pro forma|pro forma]]'' content, but counting sections such as ''Production'' and ''Reception''), which (per [[WP:SUMMARY]] and [[WP:SIZE]]) may justify an article separate from the ''List of episodes''; without such content, there is little reason for a standalone episode article. / [[User:Edgarde|edg]] [[User_talk:Edgarde|☺]] [[Special:Contributions/Edgarde|☭]] 12:07, 3 April 2009 (UTC) ::::The existence of DVD commentaries (which ''do'' exist on many Region 1 discs) and how long the article can be is irrelevant; what matters is the existence of reliable third-party publications about the individual episodes so that any articles can satisfy [[WP:N|notability]] (reviews, etc). That isn't to say that, just because some ''Friends'' episode articles have been redirected, third-party sources ''definitely don't exist'', rather that many articles couldn't be cleaned up to meet notability standards before the TTN-imposed deadline passed. Many episodes from the good years have "last night's TV"-type reviews from newspapers so those articles could be recreated if someone wanted to expand them. Once we start getting into the crap seasons, episode reviews begin to wane and it becomes harder to justify the existence of individual articles ([[The One with the Rumor]] is probably the absolute minimum threshold). [[User:Bradley0110|Bradley0110]] ([[User talk:Bradley0110|talk]]) 11:48, 12 April 2009 (UTC) :::::Agreed—I didn't intend to downplay the need for reliable third-party publications, or set an arbitrary content length. Of all the problems episode articles have, meeting the [[WP:GNG|general notability]] threshold is the most serious. / [[User:Edgarde|edg]] [[User_talk:Edgarde|☺]] [[Special:Contributions/Edgarde|☭]] 13:59, 14 April 2009 (UTC) ::::::I think I'll start going through a lot of the episodes over the weekend and see which ones have significant third-party coverage. Of the ones that do, I'll add the info to a "further reading" section and relink the articles on the LoE; the info doesn't necessarily have to be integrated straight away -- the articles just need to pass notability. [[User:Bradley0110|Bradley0110]] ([[User talk:Bradley0110|talk]]) 20:29, 17 April 2009 (UTC) :::::::I'm ''really'' late to this discussion, but I have to said that while I miss the old school pages, the new format is good. I feel it better serves readers as it concisely offers the basics on each episode of the series. Over the ten years the series was on others have gone into the details of each episode (such [http://friends-tv.org/epguide.html these folks]). I feel that new format allows the wiki to focus time and attention on the episodes that are notable and that folks remember such as the pilot or the prom video. I also feel that this new format avoids opening the cans of wiki-worms such as [[WP:OR]] or [[WP:RS]]. I hope this helps. - Thanks, ''[[User:Hoshie|Hos]]'''''[[User_talk:Hoshie|hie]]''' 11:25, 29 October 2009 (UTC) == vandalism == Who is Heather? in season 2 description it looks like some one did a huge vandalism. please someone may correct this. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/88.65.86.15|88.65.86.15]] ([[User talk:88.65.86.15|talk]]) 20:42, 9 October 2009 (UTC)

title: User talk:Jamilya~enwiki
content:
== Your account will be renamed ==
Hello, The developer team at Wikimedia is making some changes to how accounts work, as part of our on-going efforts to provide new and better tools for our users like cross-wiki notifications. These changes will mean you have the same account name everywhere. This will let us give you new features that will help you edit and discuss better, and allow more flexible user permissions for tools. One of the side-effects of this is that user accounts will now have to be unique across all 900 Wikimedia wikis. See [[m:Special:MyLanguage/Single User Login finalisation announcement|the announcement]] for more information. Unfortunately, your account clashes with another account also called Jamilya. To make sure that both of you can use all Wikimedia projects in future, we have reserved the name Jamilya~enwiki that only you will have. If you like it, you don't have to do anything. If you do not like it, you can [[Special:GlobalRenameRequest|pick out a different name]]. If you think you might own all of the accounts with this name and this message is in error, please visit [[Special:MergeAccount]] to check and attach all of your accounts to prevent them from being renamed. Your account will still work as before, and you will be credited for all your edits made so far, but you will have to use the new account name when you log in. Sorry for the inconvenience. Yours,
[[m:User:Keegan (WMF)|Keegan Peterzell]]
Community Liaison, Wikimedia Foundation
00:36, 20 March 2015 (UTC) == Renamed ==

Welcome
---- Hello and welcome to Wikipedia! We appreciate encyclopedic contributions, but some of '''[[Special:Contributions/{{BASEPAGENAME}}|your recent contributions]]'''{{#if:Hippos|, such as your edit to the page [[:Hippos]],}} do not conform to our policies. For more information on this, see [[Wikipedia:Vandalism|Wikipedia's policies on vandalism]] and [[Wikipedia:What Wikipedia is not|limits on acceptable additions]]. If you'd like to experiment with the wiki's syntax, please do so on [[Wikipedia:Sandbox]] rather than in articles. If you still have questions, there is a [[Wikipedia:New contributors' help page|new contributor's help page]], or you can write '''{{helpme}}''' below this message along with a question and someone will be along to answer it shortly. You may also find the following pages useful for a general introduction to Wikipedia. *[[Wikipedia:Five pillars|The five pillars of Wikipedia]] *[[Wikipedia:How to edit a page|How to edit a page]] *[[Help:Contents|Help pages]] *[[Wikipedia:Tutorial|Tutorial]] *[[Wikipedia:How to write a great article|How to write a great article]] *[[Wikipedia:Manual of Style|Manual of Style]] *[[Wikipedia:Neutral point of view|Policy on neutral point of view]] *[[Wikipedia:External links|Guideline on external links]] *[[Wikipedia:Conflict of interest|Guideline on conflict of interest]] I hope you enjoy editing Wikipedia! Please [[Wikipedia:Sign your posts on talk pages|sign your name]] on talk pages using four tildes (~~~~); this will automatically produce your name and the date. Feel free to write a note on the bottom of {{#if:Chuckiesdad|[[User talk:Chuckiesdad{{!}}my talk page]]|my talk page}} if you want to get in touch with me. Again, welcome! title: User talk:203.115.172.22
User talk:Esosaoj
content: == Welcome! == Hello, Esosaoj, and [[Project:Introduction|welcome]] to Wikipedia! I hope you like the place and decide to stay. Unfortunately, one or more of the pages you created, such as [[Yomi owope]], may not conform to some of Wikipedia's [[Wikipedia:List of policies|guidelines]], and may not be retained. There's a page about creating articles you may want to read called '''[[Wikipedia:Your first article|Your first article]]'''. If you are stuck, and looking for help, please come to the '''[[Wikipedia:Teahouse|Teahouse]]''', where experienced Wikipedians can answer any queries you have! Or, you can just type '''{{tl|help me}}''' on this page, followed by your question, and someone will show up shortly to answer your questions. Here are a few other good links for newcomers: * [[Wikipedia:Your first article|Your first article]] * [[Wikipedia:Contributing to Wikipedia|Contributing to Wikipedia]] * [[Wikipedia:Biographies of living persons|Biographies of living persons]] * [[Wikipedia:Article development|How to write a great article]] * [[Wikipedia:Five pillars|The five pillars of Wikipedia]] * [[Help:Contents|Help pages]] * [[Wikipedia:Tutorial|Tutorial]] I hope you enjoy editing here and being a [[Wikipedia:Wikipedians|Wikipedian]]! Please [[Wikipedia:Signatures|sign your name]] on talk pages using four tildes (~~~~); this will automatically produce your name and the date. If you have any questions, check out [[Wikipedia:Questions]] or ask me on my talk page. Again, welcome! [[User talk:SSTflyer|sst]][[User:SSTflyer|✈]] 16:23, 22 January 2016 (UTC) ==[[Wikipedia:Proposed deletion|Proposed deletion]] of [[Yomi owope]]== [[File:Ambox warning yellow.svg|left|link=|48px|]] The article [[Yomi owope]] has been [[WP:BLPPROD|proposed for deletion]] because it appears to have no references. Under [[Wikipedia:BLPPROD#Objecting|Wikipedia policy]], this '''[[WP:BLP|biography of a living person]]''' will be deleted unless it has at least one reference to a [[WP:V#Sources|reliable source]] that directly supports material in the article. If you created the article, please don't be offended. Instead, consider improving the article. For help on inserting references, see [[Wikipedia:Referencing for beginners|Referencing for beginners]], or ask at the [[Wikipedia:Help desk|help desk]]. Once you have provided at least one [[WP:V#Sources|reliable source]], you may remove the {{tl|prod blp}} tag. '''Please do not remove the tag unless the article is sourced.''' If you cannot provide such a source within seven days, the article may be deleted, but you can {{#ifexist:Yomi owope|request that it be undeleted|[[Wikipedia:Requests for undeletion|request that it be undeleted]]}} when you are ready to add one. [[User talk:SSTflyer|sst]][[User:SSTflyer|✈]] 16:23, 22 January 2016 (UTC) == [[Wikipedia:Wiki Loves Nigeria/Writing Contest|Wiki Loves Nigeria Writing Contest]] == Hello Esosaoj, and happy [[Wikipedia Day|Wikipedia @ 15]]. This is to notify you of [[Wikipedia:Wiki Loves Nigeria/Writing Contest|Wiki Loves Nigeria Writing Contest]] organized by the [[m:Wikimedia User Group Nigeria|Wikimedia User Group Nigeria]] to commiserate the 15th anniversary of Wikipedia. The contest will start on 28 January 2016 and end on 29 February 2016. Please help to suggest articles on notable Nigeria-related topic [[Wikipedia:Wiki Loves Nigeria/Writing Contest/Articles suggestions|here]] and if you like to be part of the jury, [[Wikipedia:Wiki Loves Nigeria/Writing Contest/Jury|add your name here]]. Thanks for your participation. Warm regards [[User:Wikicology|''Wi''ki''c¤''l¤''gy'']][[User talk:Wikicology|t@lk to M£]] 08:48, 23 January 2016 (UTC)

Thank you for [[Special:Contributions/CriselyDH|your contributions]] to this free encyclopedia. Please remember to [[Wikipedia:Signatures|sign your name on talk pages]] by clicking [[File:Button sig.png|link=Wikipedia:How to sign your posts]] or [[File:Insert-signature.png|link=Wikipedia:How to sign your posts]] or by typing four tildes (~~~~); this will automatically produce your username and the date. title: Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/The Law of Success
content:
It's on Cleanup, but I think this should either a '''delete,''' or a redirect to [[Napoleon Hill]]. The article was started by an anon in May 2004 and hasn't been worked on since. Suspect the intention was to promote the website for "a motivational centre in Malaysia: [http://www.kersani.com KERSANI Training Centre] where the book "has been used." The website isn't in English so I can't find out from the site what the book is or how it's used.

I can't even tell for sure what book is being discussed—the author isn't named!  

I'm '''guessing''' it's ''The Law of Success'' by [[Napoleon Hill]]. Amazon shows it as only available hardbound and in audio book format; I'm surprised it's not in paperback; this suggests to me that connoisseurs of the success oeuvre regard it as far less significant than [[Think and Grow Rich]]. Sales rank of one volume of the hardbound edition is 91,661. (Amazon sales rank of ''Think and Grow Rich'' is 391!!!!) So, the book itself is borderline; if someone deeply familiar with it actually wanted to do a good whole article on it, that would be OK, but it's not anything we actually need.  

Actually the book described in the article '''not''' seem to match perfectly with descriptions of the Napoleon Hill book, as it says there are ''forty'' chapters altogether, and the Amazon reference is entitled "The Law of Success In ''Sixteen'' Lessons," while as everybody knows (i.e. it's in another book title and is mentioned in our article on [[Think and Grow Rich]]) Hill had ''seventeen'' principles of success.

Judging by past history, I think it is very, very unlikely that the original author or anyone else is going to do much with it. [[User:Dpbsmith|[[User:Dpbsmith|Dpbsmith]] [[User_talk:dpbsmith|(talk)]]]] 15:02, 3 Sep 2004 (UTC)

*Delete.  Critical information (i.e. author, date of publication) is not only unknown but, given the scant information provided, also virtually ''unknowable'', unless someone should come along who actually owns a copy. --[[User:Smack|Smack]] 18:19, 4 Sep 2004 (UTC)
*Delete. [[User:Ambi|Ambi]] 21:42, 4 Sep 2004 (UTC)
*Delete - can't tell what it's about, and author's had since may to fix it up. -- [[User:Cyrius|Cyrius]]|[[User talk:Cyrius|✎]] 05:17, 5 Sep 2004 (UTC)

**OK, since [[Napoleon Hill]] did, in fact, write a book with that title I've just made it into a redirect to Napoleon Hill. [[User:Dpbsmith|[[User:Dpbsmith|Dpbsmith]] [[User_talk:dpbsmith|(talk)]]]] 22:58, 5 Sep 2004 (UTC)
*'''Keep the redirect'''. The book is mentioned in the [[Napoleon Hill]] article, so, the redirect is reasonable. [[User:Andris|Andris]] 22:38, Sep 8, 2004 (UTC)

title: Phish (album)
content:
{{Infobox album| | Name = Phish (The White Tape) | Type = [[Album]] | Artist = [[Phish]] | Cover = whitetape.jpg | Released = 1986 ([[compact Cassette|cassette]])
1998 ([[CD]]) | Recorded = Various locations, 1984-1986 | Genre = [[Jam rock]], [[experimental rock]] | Length = 54:27 | Label = Self-release, Phish Dry Goods | Producer = [[Trey Anastasio]] | This album = '''''Phish (The White Tape)'''''
(1986) | Next album = ''[[The Man Who Stepped into Yesterday]]''
(1987) {{Extra chronology | | Artist = ''LivePhish.com Downloads'' series | Type = Live album | Last album = ''[[Phish: New Year's Eve 1995 - Live at Madison Square Garden|Live Phish Downloads: 12.31.95]]''
(2005) | This album = ''Live Phish Downloads: The White Tape''
(2006) | Next album = ''[[Colorado '88|Live Phish Downloads: Colorado '88]]''
(2006) }}}} {{Album ratings | rev1 = [[Allmusic]] | rev1Score = (mixed){{cite web |url= http://www.allmusic.com/album/the-white-tape-r1960853 |title=The White Tape - Phish | AllMusic |first=Jesse |last=Jarnow |work=allmusic.com |year=2011 |accessdate=7 August 2011}} | rev2 = | rev2Score = }} '''''Phish''''' (also known as '''''The White Tape''''') is a self-produced album released by the American rock band [[Phish]] on cassette in [[1986 in music|1986]]. Often cited as the first Phish "album", ''The White Tape'' was originally a collection of original material that the band used as a demo/sample tape for venues, and was sometimes labelled "Phish" or simply "Demo".[http://phish.net/discography/the-white-tape The White Tape History] Phish.net. Online. Accessed: September 14, 2011. The album was widely circulated among Phish fans for more than a decade before being officially released in 1998. The album was created from four-track recordings over a period of three years and includes a number of outside musicians performing on various songs. Only "Alumni Blues", "AC/DC Bag", "Slave To The Traffic Light" and "Dog Gone Dog" (a.k.a. "Dog Log") have the four band members together. The remaining tracks were recorded separately by various members and blended together to create the finished album.[http://phish.com/#/music/the-white-tape Phish's The White Tape] Phish.com. Online. Accessed: September 14, 2011. ''The White Tape'' includes an early version of the Phish epic "[[You Enjoy Myself]]", performed ''[[a cappella]]'' with the band members singing the opening guitar lines. The album also contains [[avant-garde]] [[experimental rock|experimental]] pieces, instrumental passages, electronic noises and studio [[Audio engineering|trickery]]. Some songs were further developed and figure heavily in the band's live performances, while a few have rarely been heard since. All instruments and vocals on "Fuck Your Face", "NO2", "He Ent to the Bog" and "Minkin" are performed solely by bass guitarist [[Mike Gordon]]. All instruments and vocals on "Run Like an Antelope" and "And So to Bed" are recorded solely by [[Trey Anastasio]].{{Citation needed|date=September 2011}} "The Divided Sky", "Ingest" and "Fluff's Travels" are performed by Anastasio, Phish lyricist [[Tom Marshall (singer)|Tom Marshall]], and their friend [[Marc Daubert]] on percussion. "Aftermath" has Anastasio and Roger Holloway on guitar. "Slave to the Traffic Light" has [[Tom Marshall (singer)|Tom Marshall]] on keyboards and Pete Cottone on drums.{{Citation needed|date=September 2011}} In addition to being released on [[Compact Disc|CD]], this album was made available on June 7, 2006, as a download in [[Free Lossless Audio Codec|FLAC]] and [[MP3]] formats at LivePhish.com. A limited edition white vinyl version was released at Superball IX, Phish's 2011 summer festival with the remainder offered up for sale as part of [[Record Store Day]]'s "Black Friday" promotion on November 25, 2011. ==Track listing== All tracks written by [[Trey Anastasio]] unless otherwise noted. '''Side 1''' {{Track listing | collapsed=no | total_length= | writing_credits=yes | title1=Alumni Blues | length1=4:11 | title2=And So to Bed | length2=4:44 | title3=You Enjoy Myself | length3=0:55 | title4=AC/DC Bag | length4=4:09 | title5=Fuck Your Face | writer5=[[Mike Gordon]] | length5=2:16 | title6=The Divided Sky | length6=1:17 | title7=Slave to the Traffic Light | writer7=Anastasio, Dave Abrahams, [[The Dude of Life|Steve Pollak]] | length7=4:35 | title8=Aftermath | writer8=Trey Anastasio, Roger Holloway | length8=2:55 | title9=Ingest | length9=1:38 }} '''Side 2''' {{Track listing | collapsed=no | total_length=54:27 | writing_credits=yes | title1=NO2 | writer1=Gordon | length1=7:38 | title2=Fluff's Travels | length2=1:22 | title3=Dog Gone Dog | length3=4:03 | title4=He Ent to the Bog | writer4=Gordon, Christian McBride | length4=3:56 | title5=Run Like an Antelope | writer5=Anastasio, [[Tom Marshall (singer)|Tom Marshall]] | length5=6:41 | title6=Minkin | writer6=Gordon | length6=3:00 | title7=Letter to Jimmy Page | length7=1:17 }} ==Personnel== :[[Trey Anastasio]] - guitars, vocals :[[Page McConnell]] - keyboards, vocals :[[Mike Gordon]] - bass guitar, vocals :[[Jon Fishman]] - drums, vocals ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://phish.com/ Phish.com - Official Site] * [http://phish.com/#/music/the-white-tape Phish.com: The White Tape] * [http://phish.net/discography/the-white-tape Phish.net: The White Tape] - Includes details on cassette versions. * [http://phish.com/#/news/2011/16/the-white-tape-and-party-time-vinyl-released-on-black-friday Vinyl White Tape - Record Store Day] {{Phish}} [[Category:1986 debut albums]] [[Category:Phish albums]] [[Category:LivePhish.com Downloads]]

title: Benthophilus pinchuki
content:
{{Taxobox
| name = Pinchuk's pugolovka
| image = 
| status = NE
| status_system = IUCN3.1
| status_ref = 
| regnum = [[Animalia]]
| phylum = [[Chordata]]
| classis = [[Actinopterygii]]
| ordo = [[Perciformes]]
| familia = [[Gobiidae]]
| subfamilia = [[Benthophilinae]]
| genus = ''[[Benthophilus]]''
| species = ''B. pinchuki''
| binomial = ''Benthophilus pinchuki''
| binomial_authority = [[Dadash Bahman oglu Ragimov|Ragimov]], 1982
| synonyms =
* ''Benthophilus ctenolepidus pinchuki'' <small>Ragimov, 1982</small>
| range_map = Benthophilus pinchuki range.png
| range_map_caption = The range of the Pinchuk's pugolovka
}}

'''''Benthophilus pinchuki''''', '''Pinchuk's pugolovka''', is a [[species]] of [[goby|gobiid fish]] found along the eastern and western coasts of the [[Caspian Sea]], but absent on the middle part.<ref>Boldyrev V.S., Bogutskaya N.G. (2007) Revision of the tadpole-gobies of the genus ''Benthophilus'' (Teleostei: [[Gobiidae]]). Ichthyol. Explor. Freshwaters, 18(1): 31-96.[http://www.pfeil-verlag.de/04biol/pdf/ief18_1_04.pdf]</ref> This species has been recorded along the western coast from the [[Absheron Rayon|Absheron]] to [[Iran]], and along the eastern coast near the [[Cape Bely Bugor]] (Akdepe, Akpatlawuk), [[Turkmenistan]].

It was described initially as a subspecies of ''[[Benthophilus ctenolepidus]]'', but later considered an independent species.<ref>Eschmeyer W (2015) [http://researcharchive.calacademy.org/research/ichthyology/catalog/fishcatmain.asp [search 'pinchuki']] [[Catalog of Fishes]]. California Academy of Sciences</ref><ref>Bogutskaya N.G., Naseka A.M. 2006. [http://www.zin.ru/projects/caspdiv/caspian_fishes.html List of Agnathans and Fishes of the Caspian Sea and Rivers of its Basin]  Caspian Sea Biodiversity Project under umbrella of Caspian Sea Environment Program</ref>

title: User talk:Balletquebec
content:
[[File:Information.svg|left|50px|alt=|link=]]Welcome to Wikipedia. Because we have a [[Wikipedia:ORGNAME|policy]] against usernames that give the impression that the account represents a group, organization or website, I have [[Wikipedia:Blocking policy|blocked]] this account; '''please take a moment to [[Special:Userlogin/signup|create a new account]] with a username that represents only yourself as an individual and which complies with our [[Wikipedia:Username policy|username policy]].'''  You should also read our [[Wikipedia:Conflict of interest|conflict of interest guideline]] and be aware that promotional editing is not acceptable regardless of the username you choose.

If your username '''does not''' represent a group, organization or website, you may [[Wikipedia:Appealing a block|appeal this username block]] by adding the text {{tlx|unblock|2=reason=''Your reason here ~~~~''}} below this notice.

You may simply create a new account, but you may prefer to change your username to one that complies with our [[Wikipedia:Username policy|username policy]], so that your past contributions are associated with your new username. If you would prefer to change your username, you may appeal this username block by adding the text {{tlx|unblock-un|2=''new username''|3=reason=''Your reason here ~~~~''}} below this notice. Thank you. [[User:Alexf|Alexf]][[User talk:Alexf|(talk)]] 17:28, 4 February 2014 (UTC)
